solution_line_template: If Anthony has {anthony_total_pets} pets, the number of cats is {anthony_cat_fraction} * {anthony_total_pets} pets = <<{anthony_total_pets}*{anthony_cat_fraction}={anthony_cats}>>{anthony_cats} cats
The number of dogs that Anthony have is {anthony_total_pets} pets - {anthony_cats} cats = <<{anthony_total_pets}-{anthony_cats}={anthony_dogs}>>{anthony_dogs} dogs
If Leonel has seven more dogs than Anthony, then he has {anthony_dogs} dogs + {leonel_additional_dogs} dogs = <<{leonel_additional_dogs}+{anthony_dogs}={leonel_dogs}>>{leonel_dogs} dogs

The total number of pets the two have is {leonel_dogs} dogs for Leonel + {leonel_cats} cats for Leonel + {anthony_dogs} dogs for Anthony + {anthony_cats} cats for Anthony = <<{leonel_dogs}+{leonel_cats}+{anthony_dogs}+{anthony_cats}={total_animals}>>{total_animals}
